definition: logical/only to be expected/rational and clearly structured (of text)
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: Nani's passage to the World Cup with Portugal was plain sailing by comparison with Evra's exertions.
sentences.chinese: 納尼進入世界盃比起埃弗拉來講就順理成章的多。

sentences.english: Therefore, the Zhouyi's way of thinking has naturally become the basis for Chinese medicine.
sentences.chinese: 《周易》的思維模式也順理成章地成爲中醫學的基礎。

sentences.english: Mr. Chan's experience makes him a natural candidate to succeed Mr. Yam.
sentences.chinese: 陳德霖的經驗使他成爲任志剛順理成章的接班候選人。

sentences.english: By applying rationalism to experience, humans can make logical leaps.
sentences.chinese: 將理論應用於實踐，人類就能順理成章地進行飛躍。

sentences.english: A matter of course, two young and lonely hearts together.
sentences.chinese: 順理成章地，兩顆年輕又孤寂的心走到了一起。

sentences.english: It would follow,then,that souls can't split.
sentences.chinese: 順理成章，靈魂無法被分裂。

sentences.english: It stands to reason that you take the Bus in this heavy rain.
sentences.chinese: 在豪雨天裏你搭公車是順理成章的事。

definition: as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
variant of 關係|关系[guan1 xi5]
willing (to do sth)/to take pleasure in
